releases.title: 2026-01-19, Version 25.4.0 (Current), @RafaelGSS
releases.body:
### Notable Changes

* cli: add --require-module/--no-require-module
* cli: mark --heapsnapshot-near-heap-limit as stable
* crypto: update root certificates to NSS 3.117
* events: repurpose `events.listenerCount()` to accept EventTargets
* http: add http.setGlobalProxyFromEnv()
* module: mark require(esm) as stable
* module: mark module compile cache as stable
* module: allow subpath imports that start with `#/`
* process: preserve AsyncLocalStorage in queueMicrotask only when needed
* stream: do not pass `readable.compose()` output via `Readable.from()`
* util: add convertProcessSignalToExitCode utility
* v8: mark v8.queryObjects() as stable

releases.title: 2026-01-13, Version 25.3.0 (Current), @RafaelGSS
releases.body:
This is a security release.

### Notable Changes

* (CVE-2025-59465) add TLSSocket default error handler
* (CVE-2026-21636) add network check on pipe_wrap connect
* (CVE-2025-55130) require full read and write to symlink APIs
* (CVE-2025-55132) disable futimes when permission model is enabled
* (CVE-2025-59466) rethrow stack overflow exceptions in async_hooks
* (CVE-2025-55131) refactor unsafe buffer creation to remove zero-fill toggle
* (CVE-2026-21637) route callback exceptions through error handlers

releases.title: 2026-01-13, Version 24.13.0 'Krypton' (LTS), @marco-ippolito
releases.body:
This is a security release.

### Notable Changes

* (CVE-2025-59465) add TLSSocket default error handler
* (CVE-2025-55132) disable futimes when permission model is enabled
* (CVE-2025-55130) require full read and write to symlink APIs
* (CVE-2025-59466) rethrow stack overflow exceptions in async_hooks
* (CVE-2025-55131) refactor unsafe buffer creation to remove zero-fill toggle
* (CVE-2026-21637) route callback exceptions through error handlers

releases.body: Please refer to [CHANGELOG.md](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/v8.0.0-beta.8/packages/vite/CHANGELOG.md) for details.

releases.title: v1.57.0
releases.body:
## Speedboard

In HTML reporter, there's a new tab we call "Speedboard" - it shows you all your executed tests sorted by slowness.

## Chrome for Testing

Starting with this release, Playwright switches from Chromium to using Chrome for Testing builds.

## Waiting for webserver output

`testConfig.webServer` added a `wait` field. Pass a regular expression, and Playwright will wait until the webserver logs match it.

## Breaking Change

After 3 years of being deprecated, we removed `Page#accessibility` from our API.

## Browser Versions
- Chromium 143.0.7499.4
- Mozilla Firefox 144.0.2
- WebKit 26.0

releases.title: v1.56.1
releases.body:
## Highlights

- chore: allow local-network-access permission in chromium
- fix(agents): remove workspaceFolder ref from vscode mcp
- chore: rename agents to test agents
- chore(mcp): fallback to cwd when resolving test config

## Browser Versions
- Chromium 141.0.7390.37
- Mozilla Firefox 142.0.1
- WebKit 26.0

releases.title: v1.56.0
releases.body:
## Playwright Agents

Introducing Playwright Agents, three custom agent definitions designed to guide LLMs through the core process of building a Playwright test.

## New APIs
- New methods `page.consoleMessages()` and `page.pageErrors()` for retrieving the most recent console messages from the page
- New method `page.requests()` for retrieving the most recent network requests from the page

## Browser Versions
- Chromium 141.0.7390.37
- Mozilla Firefox 142.0.1
- WebKit 26.0

## ORM

- Fast and Small Query Compilers with new `compilerBuild` option (`fast` or `small`)
- Bypass the Query Compiler for Raw Queries
- Update MSSQL to v12.2.0
- Pin better-sqlite3 version to avoid SQLite bug
- Revert `@map` enums to v6.19.0 behavior
- Cast BigInt to text in JSON aggregation
Patch release fixing an issue with Prisma Accelerate support in some edge runtime configurations when the `@prisma/client/edge` entrypoint is not being used.

## Highlights

- feat: add `sqlcommenter-query-insights` plugin
- feat(migrate): add `-url` param for `db pull`, `db push`, `migrate dev`
- feat(config): allow undefined URLs in e.g. `prisma generate`
- feat(cli): customize `prisma init` based on the JS runtime (Bun vs others)

releases.title: 1.0.0-beta.12
releases.body:
## Breaking changes

- `.generatedAlwaysAs()` now only accepts `sql` and `() => sql`

## Improvements

- PostgreSQL dialect now has extra schema errors in ts files on `generate` and `push` commands
- SQLite dialect now has extra schema errors in ts files on `generate` and `push` commands

## Bug fixes

- Fixed various issues with drizzle-kit generate, node:crypto, and backslash in check constraints

releases.title: v1.0.0-beta.11
releases.body:
- Defaulted `PgTimestampString` timezone offset to be `+00` when value gets returned as `Date` instance
- Cache is now used only when explicitly defined
- Separated date and int-exclusive column methods from common `pg builder`

releases.title: v1.0.0-beta.9
releases.body:
- Drizzle now has native `@effect/sql-pg` driver support
- Reworked PgColumn type chain with better type performance
- Breaking: postgres `.array()` is now not chainable, use `.array('[][]')` for multidimensional
- Migrated away from `esbuild-register` to `tsx` loader
- Added native Bun and Deno launch support

### Breaking Changes

- Drop support for `pydantic.v1`.

### Refactors

- Add a custom `FastAPIDeprecationWarning`.

### Docs

- Add documentary to website.

### Breaking Changes

- Add deprecation warnings when using `pydantic.v1`.

releases.title: .NET 10.0.2
releases.body:
## What's Changed

- Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet
- Delete signalr-daily-tests.yml
- Switch to assetless build for official builds
- Add loopback addresses to the development certificate
- Fix minimal API validation for record structs
- Fix circular reference resolution for schemas containing arrays
- Improve Blazor reconnection experience after the server is restarted

releases.title: .NET 8.0.23
releases.body:
[Release](https://github.com/dotnet/core/releases/tag/v8.0.23)

https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/dotnet-and-dotnet-framework-january-2026-servicing-updates/#release-changelogs

releases.title: 8.6-RC1
releases.body:
### New Features

- Streams: `XADD` idempotency with new `IDMPAUTO` and `IDMP` arguments
- New eviction policies: `volatile-lrm` and `allkeys-lrm`
- Hot keys detection and reporting; new command: `HOTKEYS`
- TLS certificate-based automatic client authentication
- Time series: support NaN values; new aggregators: `COUNTNAN` and `COUNTALL`

## Major changes compared to 8.2

- DIGEST, DELEX; SET extensions - atomic compare-and-set and compare-and-delete
- MSETEX - atomically set multiple string keys and update their expiration
- XREADGROUP - new `CLAIM` option
- CLUSTER MIGRATION - atomic slot migration
- CLUSTER SLOT-STATS - per-slot usage metrics
- Redis query engine: FT.HYBRID - hybrid search and fused scoring
- I/O threading: substantial throughput increase

releases.title: 8.4-RC1
releases.body:
### New Features

- New command: `CLUSTER MIGRATION` - atomic slot migration
- New commands: `DELEX`, `DIGEST`; `SET` extensions
- New command: `MSETEX` - set multiple keys and update their expiration
- `XREADGROUP` - add `CLAIM min-idle-time`
- Add auto-repair options for broken AOF tail on startup

releases.title: v29.2.0-rc.2
releases.body:
### New

- `GET /info` now includes an `NRI` field for Node Resource Interface
- New `Identity` field added to the inspect endpoint to show trusted origin information

### Bug fixes and enhancements

- Improve validation of `--detach-keys` command-line options
- Prevent a potential panic on daemon shutdown
- Remove restriction on anonymous read-only volumes

releases.title: v29.1.5
releases.body:
### Packaging updates

- Update Go runtime to 1.25.6

### Networking

- Fixed a regression where established network connections could be disrupted during a container's shutdown grace period

releases.title: v29.1.4
releases.body:
### Bug fixes and enhancements

- Fix `docker run --network none` panic on Windows
- Fix image mounts failing with "file name too long" for long mount paths
- Fix potential creation of orphaned overlay2 layers

### Packaging updates

- Update BuildKit to v0.26.3

NEW FEATURES:

ENHANCEMENTS:

releases.title: v2.331.0
releases.body:
## What's Changed

* Fix owner of /home/runner directory
* Update Docker to v29.0.2 and Buildx to v0.30.1
* Bump docker image to use ubuntu 24.04
* Add support for case function
* Set ACTIONS_ORCHESTRATION_ID as env to actions
* Allow hosted VM report job telemetry via .setup_info file

releases.title: v2.330.0
releases.body:
## What's Changed

* Custom Image: Preflight checks
* Improve logic around decide IsHostedServer
* Add support for libicu73-76 for newer Debian/Ubuntu versions
* Only start runner after network is online
* Retry http error related to DNS resolution failure

releases.title: v2.329.0
releases.body:

* Acknowledge runner request
* Map RUNNER_TEMP for container action
* Bump node.js to latest version in runner
* Include k8s novolume (version v0.8.0)
* Report job has infra failure to run-service

releases.title: v1.53.0
releases.body:
### Metrics

- Stabilize part of `Enabled` SDK for synchronous instruments.

### Logs

- Add optional Ergonomic API.

### SDK Configuration

- Declarative configuration: clarify default behavior and validation requirements
- Declarative configuration: add optional programmatic customization to `create`

### Common

- Stabilize complex `AnyValue` attribute value types and related attribute limits.

releases.title: Release 1.52.0
releases.body:
## Context

- Make the W3C randomness flag required.

## Traces

- Deprecate Zipkin exporter document
- Add spec for `AlwaysRecord` sampler

## Metrics

- Stabilize `Enabled` API for synchronous instruments.

## Logs

- Stabilize `LogRecordProcessor.Enabled`.

releases.title: Release 1.51.0
releases.body:
## Metrics

- `AlignedHistogramBucketExemplarReservoir` SHOULD use a time-weighted algorithm.

## Profiles

- Document the profiles signal.

## Common

- Extend the set of attribute value types to support more complex data structures.

This is the current "Long Term Support" release.
No code changes since 3.5.0, just some dependency updates:
* Docker library updated from 28.2.2 to 28.5.2
* Built with Go 1.24.11

- [BUGFIX] Agent: fix crash shortly after startup from invalid type of object
- [BUGFIX] Scraping: fix relabel keep/drop not working

## Note for users of Native Histograms

In version 3.9, Native Histograms is no longer experimental, and the feature flag `native-histogram` has no effect.

## Changelog

- [CHANGE] Native Histograms are no longer experimental!
- [FEATURE] API: Add /api/v1/features for clients to understand which features are supported
- [FEATURE] Promtool: Add `start_timestamp` field for unit tests
- [ENHANCEMENT] UI: Add graph option to start the chart's Y axis at zero

### Features and enhancements

- Alerting: Update alerting dependency
- Azure: Improved column handling in logs query builder
- Dependencies: Bump Go to v1.25.5

### Bug fixes

- Azure: Fix `dcount` aggregation
- Azure: Fix `percentile` syntax
- Dashboards: Fix empty space under time controls when a dashboard has a lot of variables
- Postgresql: Fix variable interpolation logic when the variable has multiple values

### Features and enhancements

- Alerting: Update alerting dependency
- Azure: Improved column handling in logs query builder
- Dependencies: Bump Go to v1.25.5

### Bug fixes

- Alerting: Fix contact points issue
- Azure: Fix `dcount` aggregation
- Azure: Fix `percentile` syntax

### Features and enhancements

- Alerting: Update alerting dependency
- Dependencies: Bump Go to v1.25.5

### Bug fixes

- Alerting: Fix contact points issue
- Azure: Fix `dcount` aggregation
- Azure: Fix `percentile` syntax

releases.title: v0.49.0
releases.body:
### Features
- Real-time activity feed using fsnotify
- Add 'view' as alias for 'show' command
- Add 'bd children <id>' command
- Add validate command for sync config
- Federation: SQL user authentication, dolt sql-server mode, peer-to-peer sync
- Per-worktree export state tracking
- Jujutsu (jj) version control support
- SQLite to Dolt migration tooling
- Incremental export for large repos
- Per-field merge strategies for conflict resolution
- Interactive conflict resolution

### Bug Fixes
- Auto-correct deleted status to tombstone for JSONL compatibility
- Prevent stack overflow in handleStaleLock
- Prevent zombie state after database file replacement
- Enforce single-process mode for Dolt backend
- Stabilize tree ordering for consistent --tree output

releases.title: v0.47.1
releases.body:
### Features
- Add --ready flag to show only available work
- Add Markdown rendering to comment text

### Bug Fixes
- Prevent initialization from within git worktrees
- Exclude sync_base.jsonl from multiple JSONL files check
- Prefer issues with children/deps when choosing merge target
- Support custom issue types and statuses in MCP
- Rebuild blocked_issues_cache after rename-prefix

releases.title: v0.47.0
releases.body:
### Features
- Add --dry-run flag to preview issue creation
- Multi-repo custom types discovery
- Redirect configuration health checks
- Auto-discover workflow run ID in gate check
- Pull-first sync with 3-way merge
- Visual improvements for list tree, graph, and show commands
- Add 'attests' edge type for skill attestations
- Add bd resolve-conflicts command for JSONL merge conflicts

### Bug Fixes
- Enable cold-start bootstrap for read-only commands
- Complete socket path shortening for long workspace paths
- Silence deprecation warnings in --json mode
- Handle text timestamps in scan for cross-driver compatibility
- Windows infinite loop fixes
- Daemon request context timeout to prevent indefinite hangs

releases.title: v0.5.0
releases.body:
### Features
- Add 'read' as alias for 'show' subcommand
- Add --comment as alias for --reason in gt close
- Add OpenCode as built-in agent preset
- Convoy: redundant observers, specific ID check, dry-run flag
- Deacon: zombie-scan command for tmux-verified process cleanup
- Auto-fix capability for SessionHookCheck
- Hook registry and install command
- Mail improvements: multiple message IDs, --all flag, numeric index support
- Orphans: --aggressive flag, kill command
- Config-based role definition system
- Squash merge for Refinery to eliminate redundant merge commits
- Cross-account session access in Seance
- Misclassified wisp detection and defense-in-depth filtering
- Configurable polecat branch naming

### Bug Fixes
- Multi-repo routing for custom types and role slots
- Auto-recover from stale tmux pane references
- Use registered rigs for merge queue instead of hardcoded repos
- Allow feature branches in contributor workflow
- Session counter bug and --cleanup-orphans flag
- Prevent gt done from killing itself during session cleanup
- Resolve claude path for alias installations
